## Esna 140 {-}



- Location: Intercolumnar C
- Date: Domitian
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna002.pdf#page=323){target="_blank"}
- Bibliography: None

#### Title {-}

<div class="col2">

| ^1^ *ỉr snṯr n bȝ.w fdw wr.w  *
|   
| ^1^ Doing incense for the four great rams.

</div>

#### The King {-}

<div class="col2">

| ^2^ *nsw.t-bỉty  *
| *(ỉwtkr(tr) ksrs)|  *
| ^3^ *zȝ-Rʿ  *
| *(tymtyns ḫwỉ)|  *
|  
| ^2^ King of Upper and Lower Egypt,
| (Autokra(tor) Caesar)|,
| ^3^ Son of Re,
| (Domitian Augustus)|

</div>

#### The Four Rams {-}

<div class="col2">

| ^4^ *bȝ n šw nb Iwny.t  *
| ^5^ *bȝ n Rʿ ḫnt ỉȝ.t-[ṯȝ.wy]  *
| ^6^ *bȝ n Gbb nb ḥw.t-ỉt  *
| ^7^ *bȝ n Wsỉr nb tȝ-sn.t  *
|  
| ^4^ The Ba of Shu, Lord of Iunyt.
| ^5^ The Ba of Re within the Nome of [the Chicks][^fn-140-1].
| ^6^ The Ba of Geb, Lord of Temple of the Father.
| ^7^ The Ba of Osiris, Lord of Esna.

</div>

[^fn-140-1]: Restored from context, since the other locations are all Esna toponyms. In other texts, the four rams are linked to sites throughout Egypt (*Esna* II, 17, 47-48; *Esna* III, 250, 16-17).
